ObsSpectrum2D¶

class misfit.ObsSpectrum2D(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: misfit.ObsSpectrum2DBasic

Class to hold 2D spectra.

Takes flux, flux_err, spec_mask, spec_weight (2D arrays),
wave (1D arrays) as input.
Additional attributes:
band: spectrum band name slit_PA: slit PA (parallel to slit) CCW relative to North (North = 0deg, East=90deg)

Assumed shape: rows: spatial, columns: wavelength (eg, [ind_spatial, ind_wave])

Lines to be modeled+fit: at minimum, input:

linegroup_name (eg, ‘OIII’ to get OIII doublet)

or else explicitly set:
linenames_arr restwave_arr flux_ratio_arr
Optional keywords:
units_wave (default: ‘angstroms’) units_flux (default: ‘flam’)

Methods Documentation

calculate_fit_weights()[source]¶

Determine weighting for fitting – eg, upweight edges if weighting_type=’up-edges’

fit_emission_y_profile(galaxy, instrument, filename_plot=None, plot=False)[source]¶
fit_prep_calcs(galaxy, instrument, **kwargs)[source]¶

Prepare a copy ObsSpectrum2D class which holds the input spec2D, then subtract continuum, mask, and trim spec2D for fitting.

At minimum, input linegroup_name (eg, ‘OIII’ to get OIII doublet)

Either input linenames_arr (to read all line ranges, etc) from default MISFIT param file,

or input explicit parameter filenames + linenames_arr or directly input trim_restwave_range (and have galaxy.z set) to do in restframe,

or trim_obsframe_range to trim in observed frame or param_filename and linename to read the set from a parameters file.
get_low_snr_mask(debug=False)[source]¶
get_m0_lam0_pos(galaxy)[source]¶

Determine m0_shift, lam0 for fitting – exact position, not rounded.

get_skyline_mask(full=True)[source]¶

initialize_skylevels()[source]¶
subtract_continuum(galaxy, no_cont_subtraction=False)[source]¶

Subtract continuum from 2D spectrum, fixing slope of every row to that of 1D spectrum. Requires wave, flux, flux_err, spec_weight

trim_spectrum_spatial(galaxy, instrument)[source]¶
Method to trim the 2D spectrum to a given spatial range – in preparation for fitting.
Trim vertically: identify yposition and bounding pixel indices:
trim_spectrum_wavelength(galaxy, trim_restwave_range=None, trim_obswave_range=None, param_restwave_filename=None, linename=None, inplace=False)[source]¶

Method to trim the 2D spectrum to a given wavelength range. Either input trim_restwave_range (and have galaxy.z set) to do in restframe,

or trim_obsframe_range to trim in observed frame or param_filename and linename to read the set from a parameters file.

Returns a trimmed copy of self
